title: Ticket #2379: Starter Pre and Post scripts are not documented
description: Starter Pre and Post scripts came up in a previous LIGO call. Anyhow, I can't find anything about them in the manual, and I've done a ton of searching. For info in the code, take a look at baseStarter.cpp script_proc.* in condor_starter.V6.1.
remarks:
Greg says that this feature has been present since 2004 (at least). Is LIGO currently using this undocumented feature, or just asking questions about it?

2011-Aug-17 12:01:34 by wenger:
I'm not sure if LIGO is actually using it or not, but I'd guess they are using it, since they're aware of it.

2011-Sep-13 14:21:07 by smoler:
From Greg T, on Aug 18:

I was going to write up docs on pre and post script, but it seems like the post script doesn't work. So, let's hold off on docs for now. -greg

So, Karen is placing this doc ticket in the stalled state.

2012-Mar-09 17:14:01 by gthain:
I've added some simple remarks in the condor_submit man page for these guys.

2012-Mar-12 12:13:19 by smoler:
Moved defn and rewrote descriptions. These are implemented with specially-named attributes. They are not submit commands. So, description needs to say this, and show a '+' sign in the documentation.
